SEARCH

All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
AudioManager
AudioManager is a singleton class that handles the playing, pausing, and stopping of audio files in the game.
BasePanel
The BasePanel class is an abstract class that extends JPanel, providing a base for game panels with a predefined background color and preferred size based on the game's dimensions.
Blubba
The Blubba class represents a specific type of enemy in the game.
Boulder
The Boulder class represents a movable object that behaves as a projectile within the game.
Bubble
The Bubble class represents a movable object that can catch enemies and interact with players in the game.
Collidable
Interface to represent the characteristic of Collidable
CollisionDetection
The CollisionDetection class is responsible for detecting collisions between game objects.
CollisionDetection.CollisionDirection
Enum representing the direction of a collision.
Enemy
The Enemy class represents a hostile entity in the game that can move, patrol, be caught, or freed.
Enemy.State
Enum representing the various states the enemy can be in.
Entity
The Entity class represents a movable entity in the game that can jump, attack, and be observed by multiple observers.
GameController
GameController is the main class that manages the game flow, including user interactions, level transitions, game states, and player actions.
GameController.GameState
Enumeration representing the different states the game can be in.
GameFont
The GameFont class is responsible for loading a custom font from a specified file path and registering it with the local graphics environment.
GameImage
The GameImage enum defines a collection of image resources used in the game.
GameObject
The GameObject class represents a generic game object in a 2D space with position, size, visibility, and destruction status.
GameOverPanel
The GameOverPanel class represents the panel displayed when the game is over.
GamePanel
The GamePanel class is responsible for rendering the game UI components, including the player view, score, level, lives, and the game objects.
JBubbleBobble
 
KeyHandler
KeyHandler handles keyboard input for various game states.
LevelComponent
The LevelComponent class represents a component of a game level, consisting of walls and enemies.
LevelMap
The LevelMap enum defines different levels in the game, each associated with a set of walls and enemies.
LevelSetter
The LevelSetter interface defines a contract for creating initial game level components.
MainFrame
The MainFrame class represents the main window of the game.
MenuPanel
The MenuPanel class represents the main menu of the game, allowing players to navigate between options such as "NEW GAME", "CONTINUE", and "EXIT".
Mighta
The Mighta class represents a type of enemy in the game that can attack the player if the player is within a specified range.
MovableObject
The MovableObject class represents an object in the game that can move and is affected by gravity.
MovableObject.Direction
Enum representing the direction of movement (left or right).
Observable
The Observable interface defines a contract for observable objects in a subject-observer design pattern.
Observer
The Observer interface defines a contract for observer objects in a subject-observer design pattern.
PausePanel
Represents a pause panel that displays a pause message and instructions for resuming the game.
Player
The Player class represents a player entity in the game.
PlayerObserver
The PlayerObserver interface defines a contract for observers that wish to be notified when the player's lives decrease.
PlayerView
Represents the visual representation of a player in the game.
PowerUp
The PowerUp class represents a collectible item in the game that provides points or other benefits to the player when collected.
PowerUp.PowerUpFactory
Factory class for creating instances of PowerUp.
PowerUp.Type
 
RankPanel
Represents a ranking panel that displays a list of users and their scores.
RegisterPanel
RegisterPanel is a JPanel that provides a user interface for user registration, allowing users to select an avatar and enter a nickname.
ScrollLogin
ScrollLogin is a JScrollPane that displays a list of users, allowing the selection of a user to log in to a game.
StartPanel
StartPanel is the initial panel displayed at the start of the game, featuring a title image and a "PRESS START" message.
User
The User class represents a player in the game, containing information about their avatar, nickname, and game statistics.
UserDatabase
The UserDatabase class is a singleton that manages user data, allowing for saving, loading, and managing user records.
Utility
The Utility class provides various utility methods and constants used throughout the game.
VictoryPanel
VictoryPanel is displayed when the player wins the game, showing a victory message.
Wall
The Wall class represents the physical wall of the game.
Wall.WallType
Enumeration for wall types
ZenChan
The ZenChan class represents a type of enemy in the game that moves towards the player if the player is within a specified range.
